data.title: Niko McCarty on LinkedIn: David Deamer had a "vision" about strands of DNA passing through a channel…
data.meta_description: David Deamer had a "vision" about strands of DNA passing through a channel while sitting in California traffic. He spent the next 7 years proving that his idea…
data.text:
Biodiversity Reporting and Oxford Nanopore Sequencing I’m over the moon to share that as per #Apple’s recent announcement Oxford Nanopore technology is compatible with Apple devices containing M3 silicon chips, which will enable complex analysis required for DNA/RNA sequencing for all biomes, even in remote locations. This opens a whole world of immediate opportunities and makes #nanopore sequencing more accessible to wider population, as this technology is not restricted to human genome sequencing only but, has multiple applications in critical #biodiversitymonitoring. #nanopore is already engaged in good work collaborating on this front with global research organisations. Please see https://lnkd.in/e92fiNhF New Lab In Sri Lanka To Detect Endangered Sharks In Fish Markets (forbes.com) There is no sector that doesn’t benefit directly/indirectly from #naturalresources. And given that the Earth may cross 1.5degrees C this decade, therefore there is a real need to protect our Terra Firma’s biodiversity….I would strongly urge all sustainability professionals in #finance and other industries to start integrating #accounting4nature in their corporate strategies. Please see this really informative video by #TFND that shares common insights on why taking #actionnow on #biodiversity is utterly critical for maintaining #BAU and for #riskmanagement. https://lnkd.in/eWi59rPy If you want to manage your #businessrisks, Lead by example on #sustainability Adopt #impactmanagement Build #natureresilience and accurately report on #BiodiversityKPIs...I strongly suggest that you embrace the guidance provided by #TFND (Task Force for Nature Based Disclosures) and take advantage of exploring #nanopore sequencing technology to accurately report on #biodiversityindicators

This is Nobel prize level improvement over previous linear models, similar to when attention is all you need was released in 2017. What an amazing invention will do for DNA sequencing is almost umimanginable. Cross creation of fully loaded synthetic chromosomes past 99%. Synthesis of long molecule chains without needing to do quadratic explosion on algorithm length. -Synthesis of compounds using pre-loaded containers in your house on a synthesis machine from premade packets sent to your house (the AI can accurately predict the flavour of the synthesized substance to eat it wthout creating it. -backtracking and storing fresh data on stings in sequence without losing functionaliy. Full Nobel Prize recognition for this discovery.

So, Mamba is better than transformers for DNA sequencing. This is a significant advancement for agents in the system when recognizing DNA sequencing. Good job! The Mamba Agent code is finally released: Check it out here: https://lnkd.in/dusVymM8 Uses real values as default. Loads the SSM parameters directly from High-Bandwidth Memory (HBM) to fast SRAM/SOTMRAM (future) where discretization and recurrence are performed, then writes the final results back to HBM. Recomputation is used to reduce memory requirements. Implements a linear long sequencing parallel long scan with efficient memory use. Parameterizes the SSM parameters based on the input. Solves the efficient convolution problem with a hardware-aware algorithm that computes the model consecutively with a scan instead of convolution. 3x faster on A100 GPUs. Combines SSM with the MLP block of transformers into a single block (Mamba block). Uses selection with Simplified State Space layers for sequencing modeling. The S6 model outperforms GPT++ using SwiGLU, MLP, and RMSN norm with perfect generalization to 1 million sequences. Obviously, you can see where we are going with this...

I am delighted to announce the publication of our research paper titled "𝐒𝐤𝐢𝐧 𝐋𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐅𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐅𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐒𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐔𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐗𝐆𝐁𝐨𝐨𝐬𝐭 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐫," in the esteemed 𝙄𝙀𝙀𝙀 𝙎𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨' 𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙤𝙣 𝙀𝙡𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙡, 𝙀𝙡𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙧𝙤𝙣𝙞𝙘𝙨, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙥𝙪𝙩𝙚𝙧 𝙎𝙘𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 (𝙎𝘾𝙀𝙀𝘾𝙎) 2024. 𝑯𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒍𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕𝒔 𝒐𝒇 𝑶𝒖𝒓 𝑾𝒐𝒓𝒌: 𝐨 Our innovative approach employs a deep feature fusion technique, leveraging the strengths of various pre-trained deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) to capture complex patterns in dermoscopic images indicative of malignant and benign skin lesions. 𝐨 Through meticulous feature selection via the XGBoost classifier, we achieved an impressive area under the curve (AUC) value of 0.95, indicating the high accuracy and reliability of our classification model. 𝐨 This research has the potential to revolutionize early skin cancer detection and diagnosis, significantly impacting patient outcomes and treatment strategies. A heartfelt thank you to my incredible team of co-authors: Dr. Ritesh Maurya, Prof. M.K. Dutta, 𝑵𝒂𝒈𝒆𝒔𝒉𝒘𝒂𝒓 𝑵𝒂𝒕𝒉 𝑷𝒂𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒚, 𝑺𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒊𝒗𝒂𝒔𝒂 𝑴𝒖𝒓𝒕𝒉𝒚 𝒀 𝑽, and 𝑻 𝑮𝒐𝒑𝒂𝒍𝒂𝒌𝒓𝒊𝒔𝒉𝒏𝒂𝒏, as well as our supportive institutions: 𝗔𝗠𝗜𝗧𝗬 𝗨𝗡𝗜𝗩𝗘𝗥𝗦𝗜𝗧𝗬, 𝗦𝗜𝗞𝗦𝗛𝗔 '𝗢’ 𝗔𝗡𝗨𝗦𝗔𝗡𝗗𝗛𝗔𝗡, and 𝗠𝗔𝗡𝗜𝗣𝗔𝗟 𝗜𝗡𝗦𝗧𝗜𝗧𝗨𝗧𝗘 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛𝗡𝗢𝗟𝗢𝗚𝗬, for their unwavering dedication and contributions to this project. #IEEE #SCEECS2024 #SkinCancerDetection #DeepLearning #MachineLearning #Innovation #ResearchImpact Full paper available here:

I am happy to share this paper on the modelling of the complex behavior of a physical receptron undergoing reprogramming and computing processes during the stochastic generation of Boolean functions. In the receptron model (a generalization of the perceptron) the weighting of the input stimuli is not just responding separately to each stimulus. Network’s weights are functions of a convolution of the spatial location of the input topology. A receptron has the capability to generate a complete set of Boolean functions (including those non-linearly separable) of n variables for classification tasks, without having been explicitly programmed for that. Practical realizations of the receptron include devices made of a nanostructured metallic film interconnecting a generic pattern of electrical contacts. https://lnkd.in/dv72nWGN #neuromorphic #computing #nanotechnology #boolean #classification #unconventionalcomputing #receptron #neuralnetwork #nanoparticle
